intro: Lessingia micradenia var. micradenia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. It has a low, spreading growth habit and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
